Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class Connector

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
Direct Known Subclasses:
Client, Server
public abstract class Connector extends Object
Abstract base class for connection factories.
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • getTelemetryConfig

      public TelemetryConfig getTelemetryConfig()
      Returns the telemetry configuration for this connector.
      Returns:
      the telemetry configuration, or null if not configured

    • setTelemetryConfig

      public void setTelemetryConfig(TelemetryConfig telemetryConfig)
      Sets the telemetry configuration for this connector. When set, connections created by this connector will have telemetry enabled.
      Parameters:
      telemetryConfig - the telemetry configuration

    • isTelemetryEnabled

      public boolean isTelemetryEnabled()
      Returns true if telemetry is enabled for this connector. Telemetry is enabled when a TelemetryConfig has been set.
      Returns:
      true if telemetry is enabled

    • getMaxNetInSize

      public int getMaxNetInSize()
      Returns the maximum allowed size for the network input buffer.

      This limit protects against buggy receive() implementations that never consume data, which would otherwise cause unbounded memory growth.

      Returns:
      the maximum buffer size in bytes

    • setMaxNetInSize

      public void setMaxNetInSize(int size)
      Sets the maximum allowed size for the network input buffer.

      If a connection's input buffer exceeds this limit, the connection will be closed with an error. This typically indicates a bug in the receive() implementation that is not consuming incoming data.

      Set to 0 to disable the limit (not recommended).

      Parameters:
      size - the maximum buffer size in bytes

    • isMetricsEnabled

      protected boolean isMetricsEnabled()
      Returns true if metrics collection should be enabled for this connector. Metrics are enabled when telemetry is configured and metrics are enabled.

      Use this in subclass start() methods before initializing metrics: 

      
 protected void start() {
     super.start();
     // ... other initialization ...
     if (isMetricsEnabled()) {
         metrics = new MyServerMetrics(getTelemetryConfig());
     }
 }
      Returns:
      true if metrics should be collected

    • newConnection

      protected abstract Connection newConnection(SocketChannel channel, SSLEngine engine)
      Returns a new connection for the given channel.
      Parameters:
      channel - the socket channel
      engine - if this connector is secure, the SSL engine to use

    • configureSSLEngine

      protected void configureSSLEngine(SSLEngine engine)
      Configures SSL engine settings. Default implementation sets useClientMode to false and configures SNI if enabled. Subclasses can override to add additional SSL configuration.
      Parameters:
      engine - the SSL engine to configure

    • isSecure

      public boolean isSecure()
      Indicates whether connections created by this connector should use transport layer security immediately.

    • setSecure

      public void setSecure(boolean flag)
      Sets whether connections created by this connector should use transport layer security immediately. If true, you should also specify a key store for the server certificate.
      Parameters:
      flag - whether this connector should be secure

    • setKeystoreFile

      public void setKeystoreFile(String file)

    • setKeystorePass

      public void setKeystorePass(String pass)

    • setKeystoreFormat

      public void setKeystoreFormat(String format)

    • setSSLContext

      public void setSSLContext(SSLContext context)
      Sets the SSL context to use for secure connections.

      This allows clients to configure a custom SSL context, for example with specific trust managers or key managers. When set, this context is used instead of creating one from the keystore configuration.

      Parameters:
      context - the SSL context to use

    • getSSLContext

      public SSLContext getSSLContext()
      Returns the SSL context used for secure connections.
      Returns:
      the SSL context, or null if not configured

    • setSniHostnames

      public void setSniHostnames(Map<String,String> hostnames)
      Sets the SNI (Server Name Indication) hostname to certificate alias mapping.

      This allows the server to present different certificates based on the hostname requested by the client during TLS handshake. The keystore must contain certificates with the specified aliases.

      Hostname keys can be:

      • Exact hostnames: "example.com"
      • Wildcard patterns: "*.example.com" (matches any subdomain)

      Example configuration in gumdroprc: 

       <property name="sni-hostnames">
     <map>
         <entry key="example.com" value="example-cert"/>
         <entry key="*.example.com" value="example-wildcard"/>
         <entry key="other.com" value="other-cert"/>
     </map>
 </property>
      Parameters:
      hostnames - map of hostnames to certificate aliases

    • setSniDefaultAlias

      public void setSniDefaultAlias(String alias)
      Sets the default certificate alias to use when SNI hostname is not matched or when the client doesn't provide SNI.
      Parameters:
      alias - the default certificate alias in the keystore

    • isSNIEnabled

      public boolean isSNIEnabled()
      Returns true if SNI (Server Name Indication) is configured for this connector.
      Returns:
      true if SNI hostname mappings have been configured

    • start

      protected void start()
      Starts this connector. Initializes SSL context if SSL configuration is provided.

    • stop

      protected void stop()
      Stops this connector.

    • getDescription

      protected abstract String getDescription()
      Returns a short (one word) description of this connector.
